headline: Cheaper Holiday Goods Will Give the Economy a Boost Into 2025
summary: Slowing goods inflation has unleashed more consumer spending power.  “Since the pandemic, this is the first holiday season where a lot of the holiday categories are seeing price declines year-over-year,” said Michelle Meyer, Mastercard chief economist and head of the Mastercard Economics Institute, “If you go back to prepandemic times, a lot of these categories, particularly things like appliances and electronics, where there’s a lot of technology advancements and innovations, tend to be deflationary rather than inflationary.”  In the third quarter, personal consumption expenditures, a proxy for consumer activity, rose by 3.7% for the quarter, the best performance since the first quarter of 2023.

raw.headline: Cheaper Holiday Goods Will Give the Economy a Boost Into 2025
raw.summary: Slowing goods inflation has unleashed more consumer spending power.  “Since the pandemic, this is the first holiday season where a lot of the holiday categories are seeing price declines year-over-year,” said Michelle Meyer, Mastercard chief economist and head of the Mastercard Economics Institute, “If you go back to prepandemic times, a lot of these categories, particularly things like appliances and electronics, where there’s a lot of technology advancements and innovations, tend to be deflationary rather than inflationary.”  In the third quarter, personal consumption expenditures, a proxy for consumer activity, rose by 3.7% for the quarter, the best performance since the first quarter of 2023.

headline: Mastercard's Path To Mid-Teens Growth: Analysts Weigh In After Investor Day
summary: Analysts expressed views on Mastercard Incorporated (NYSE:MA) following its investor day event this week. The company anticipates a compound annual growth rate (CAGR) in the mid-teens for EPS over the next three years, down from its prior expectation of low-20s growth for 2022-2024. BMO Capital Markets analyst Rufus Hone raised the price target to $565 from $550 and reaffirmed the Outperform rating. The analyst writes that Mastercard outlined its 2025-2027E financial targets, addressing concerns

headline: Mastercard reinvents checkout with password and number free payments
summary: MIAMI, November 14, 2024--Mastercard today announced its vision to transform online shopping by 2030. Imagine a future where no physical card numbers are needed for purchases. Where passwords or one-time codes are obsolete, and secure on-device biometrics allow seamless authentication across devices and websites, ensuring personal data stays on the device. This vision is already becoming a reality today in major markets and is poised to become ubiquitous within a few short years.
